content.text:
Clinical case 01.
Symptoms: 20-year-old woman from Sudan/Uganda presenting with fever, severe asthenia, chest and abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, diarrhoea, gum bleeding, and shock.
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 20-year-old woman from Sudan/Uganda presenting with fever, severe asthenia, chest and abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, diarrhoea, gum bleeding, and shock.

Diagnosis: Ebola Haemorrhagic Fever

Confirmation/Key evidence: Confirmed by positive ELISA antigen and PCR for Ebola virus; negative for IgG antibody initially.

meta.symptoms: 20-year-old woman from Sudan/Uganda presenting with fever, severe asthenia, chest and abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, diarrhoea, gum bleeding, and shock.
meta.confirmation: Confirmed by positive ELISA antigen and PCR for Ebola virus; negative for IgG antibody initially.

content.text:
Clinical case 02.
Symptoms: 7-year-old girl from Peru with a painless, indurated, plaque-like ulcer on the nose (4 months duration).
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 7-year-old girl from Peru with a painless, indurated, plaque-like ulcer on the nose (4 months duration).

Diagnosis: Cutaneous Leishmaniasis

Confirmation/Key evidence: Giemsa-stained slit-skin smear, culture, or PCR identifying Leishmania Viannia peruviana.

meta.symptoms: 7-year-old girl from Peru with a painless, indurated, plaque-like ulcer on the nose (4 months duration).
meta.confirmation: Giemsa-stained slit-skin smear, culture, or PCR identifying Leishmania Viannia peruviana.

content.text:
Clinical case 03.
Symptoms: 26-year-old Malawian woman with insidious headache, confusion, fever, and left-sided unilateral ptosis (3rd nerve palsy).
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 26-year-old Malawian woman with insidious headache, confusion, fever, and left-sided unilateral ptosis (3rd nerve palsy).

Diagnosis: Tuberculous Meningitis

Confirmation/Key evidence: CSF analysis showing lymphocytic predominance, high protein, low glucose. Ziehl–Neelsen stain showing acid-fast bacilli.

meta.symptoms: 26-year-old Malawian woman with insidious headache, confusion, fever, and left-sided unilateral ptosis (3rd nerve palsy).
meta.confirmation: CSF analysis showing lymphocytic predominance, high protein, low glucose. Ziehl–Neelsen stain showing acid-fast bacilli.

content.text:
Clinical case 04.
Symptoms: 4-year-old girl from Uganda in coma (Blantyre Coma Score 1/5) with fever, anaemia, and hepatosplenomegaly.
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 4-year-old girl from Uganda in coma (Blantyre Coma Score 1/5) with fever, anaemia, and hepatosplenomegaly.

Diagnosis: Cerebral Malaria

Confirmation/Key evidence: Positive malaria RDT/smear plus 'malarial retinopathy' (retinal whitening, white-centred haemorrhages).

meta.symptoms: 4-year-old girl from Uganda in coma (Blantyre Coma Score 1/5) with fever, anaemia, and hepatosplenomegaly.
meta.confirmation: Positive malaria RDT/smear plus 'malarial retinopathy' (retinal whitening, white-centred haemorrhages).

content.text:
Clinical case 06.
Symptoms: 36-year-old male returning from Botswana with a mobile, itchy, serpiginous subcutaneous mass (migratory swelling) on the chest and shoulder.
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 36-year-old male returning from Botswana with a mobile, itchy, serpiginous subcutaneous mass (migratory swelling) on the chest and shoulder.

Diagnosis: Gnathostomiasis

Confirmation/Key evidence: Clinical presentation after eating raw fish. Worm (Gnathostoma spinigerum) identified after migrating out of nose.

meta.symptoms: 36-year-old male returning from Botswana with a mobile, itchy, serpiginous subcutaneous mass (migratory swelling) on the chest and shoulder.
meta.confirmation: Clinical presentation after eating raw fish. Worm (Gnathostoma spinigerum) identified after migrating out of nose.

content.text:
Clinical case 07.
Symptoms: 28-year-old male from Malawi with shortness of breath (heart failure), hypertension, renal failure, and history of haematuria.
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 28-year-old male from Malawi with shortness of breath (heart failure), hypertension, renal failure, and history of haematuria.

Diagnosis: Genitourinary Schistosomiasis

Confirmation/Key evidence: Cystoscopy showing 'sandy patches'. S. haematobium eggs in urine or biopsy.

meta.symptoms: 28-year-old male from Malawi with shortness of breath (heart failure), hypertension, renal failure, and history of haematuria.
meta.confirmation: Cystoscopy showing 'sandy patches'. S. haematobium eggs in urine or biopsy.

content.text:
Clinical case 08.
Symptoms: 26-year-old female traveller returning from Ghana with a non-healing boil on the leg containing a central punctum and sensation of movement.
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 26-year-old female traveller returning from Ghana with a non-healing boil on the leg containing a central punctum and sensation of movement.

Diagnosis: Myiasis

Confirmation/Key evidence: Visual identification of the Tumbu fly larva (Cordylobia anthropophaga).

meta.symptoms: 26-year-old female traveller returning from Ghana with a non-healing boil on the leg containing a central punctum and sensation of movement.
meta.confirmation: Visual identification of the Tumbu fly larva (Cordylobia anthropophaga).

content.text:
Clinical case 09.
Symptoms: 16-year-old girl in Vietnam with fever, headache, myalgia, gum bleeding, macular rash, and thrombocytopenia.
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 16-year-old girl in Vietnam with fever, headache, myalgia, gum bleeding, macular rash, and thrombocytopenia.

Diagnosis: Dengue

Confirmation/Key evidence: NS1 antigen, IgM/IgG serology, or PCR. Tourniquet test indicates capillary fragility.

meta.symptoms: 16-year-old girl in Vietnam with fever, headache, myalgia, gum bleeding, macular rash, and thrombocytopenia.
meta.confirmation: NS1 antigen, IgM/IgG serology, or PCR. Tourniquet test indicates capillary fragility.

content.text:
Clinical case 10.
Symptoms: 55-year-old Indigenous Australian woman with widespread exfoliating rash, hyperkeratotic crusts, and secondary sepsis.
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 55-year-old Indigenous Australian woman with widespread exfoliating rash, hyperkeratotic crusts, and secondary sepsis.

Diagnosis: Crusted (Norwegian) Scabies

Confirmation/Key evidence: Microscopy of skin scrapings revealing massive numbers of Sarcoptes scabiei mites and eggs.

meta.symptoms: 55-year-old Indigenous Australian woman with widespread exfoliating rash, hyperkeratotic crusts, and secondary sepsis.
meta.confirmation: Microscopy of skin scrapings revealing massive numbers of Sarcoptes scabiei mites and eggs.

content.text:
Clinical case 11.
Symptoms: 45-year-old Malawian man with chronic back pain, difficulty walking, spastic paraparesis, and sensory loss at T9.
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 45-year-old Malawian man with chronic back pain, difficulty walking, spastic paraparesis, and sensory loss at T9.

Diagnosis: Spinal Tuberculosis (Pott's Disease)

Confirmation/Key evidence: Spinal radiograph showing paravertebral soft tissue mass and collapsed vertebra.

meta.symptoms: 45-year-old Malawian man with chronic back pain, difficulty walking, spastic paraparesis, and sensory loss at T9.
meta.confirmation: Spinal radiograph showing paravertebral soft tissue mass and collapsed vertebra.

content.text:
Clinical case 12.
Symptoms: 29-year-old man from The Gambia with multiple painful genital ulcers with ragged edges and purulent bases.
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 29-year-old man from The Gambia with multiple painful genital ulcers with ragged edges and purulent bases.

Diagnosis: Chancroid

Confirmation/Key evidence: Culture of Haemophilus ducreyi (difficult) or PCR.

meta.symptoms: 29-year-old man from The Gambia with multiple painful genital ulcers with ragged edges and purulent bases.
meta.confirmation: Culture of Haemophilus ducreyi (difficult) or PCR.

content.text:
Clinical case 14.
Symptoms: 22-year-old woman in Bangladesh with acute profuse watery diarrhoea ('rice-water'), severe dehydration.
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 22-year-old woman in Bangladesh with acute profuse watery diarrhoea ('rice-water'), severe dehydration.

Diagnosis: Cholera

Confirmation/Key evidence: Stool culture on TCBS agar growing Vibrio cholerae; 'shooting star' motility on microscopy.

meta.symptoms: 22-year-old woman in Bangladesh with acute profuse watery diarrhoea ('rice-water'), severe dehydration.
meta.confirmation: Stool culture on TCBS agar growing Vibrio cholerae; 'shooting star' motility on microscopy.

content.text:
Clinical case 15.
Symptoms: 3-year-old boy from Laos with fever and a unilateral suppurative parotid abscess.
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 3-year-old boy from Laos with fever and a unilateral suppurative parotid abscess.

Diagnosis: Melioidosis (Parotitis)

Confirmation/Key evidence: Culture of pus growing Burkholderia pseudomallei.

meta.symptoms: 3-year-old boy from Laos with fever and a unilateral suppurative parotid abscess.
meta.confirmation: Culture of pus growing Burkholderia pseudomallei.

content.text:
Clinical case 17.
Symptoms: 34-year-old man from Thailand with fever, wasting, lymphadenopathy, and multiple umbilicated papules with central necrosis.
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 34-year-old man from Thailand with fever, wasting, lymphadenopathy, and multiple umbilicated papules with central necrosis.

Diagnosis: Penicilliosis (Talaromycosis)

Confirmation/Key evidence: Microscopy/culture of skin biopsy or lymph node identifying Talaromyces marneffei.

meta.symptoms: 34-year-old man from Thailand with fever, wasting, lymphadenopathy, and multiple umbilicated papules with central necrosis.
meta.confirmation: Microscopy/culture of skin biopsy or lymph node identifying Talaromyces marneffei.

content.text:
Clinical case 18.
Symptoms: 43-year-old male traveller returning from Mozambique with fever, eosinophilia, and nodular lung lesions.
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 43-year-old male traveller returning from Mozambique with fever, eosinophilia, and nodular lung lesions.

Diagnosis: Acute Schistosomiasis (Katayama Syndrome)

Confirmation/Key evidence: Seroconversion and detection of S. mansoni eggs.

meta.symptoms: 43-year-old male traveller returning from Mozambique with fever, eosinophilia, and nodular lung lesions.
meta.confirmation: Seroconversion and detection of S. mansoni eggs.

content.text:
Clinical case 19.
Symptoms: 40-year-old man from Togo with subcutaneous nodules, pruritus, skin atrophy, and corneal opacity.
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 40-year-old man from Togo with subcutaneous nodules, pruritus, skin atrophy, and corneal opacity.

Diagnosis: Onchocerciasis (River Blindness)

Confirmation/Key evidence: Skin snips showing Onchocerca volvulus microfilariae.

meta.symptoms: 40-year-old man from Togo with subcutaneous nodules, pruritus, skin atrophy, and corneal opacity.
meta.confirmation: Skin snips showing Onchocerca volvulus microfilariae.

content.text:
Clinical case 20.
Symptoms: 56-year-old man returning to Thailand with fatigue, back pain, and marked peripheral eosinophilia.
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 56-year-old man returning to Thailand with fatigue, back pain, and marked peripheral eosinophilia.

Diagnosis: Strongyloidiasis

Confirmation/Key evidence: Detection of Strongyloides stercoralis larvae in stool sediments.

meta.symptoms: 56-year-old man returning to Thailand with fatigue, back pain, and marked peripheral eosinophilia.
meta.confirmation: Detection of Strongyloides stercoralis larvae in stool sediments.

content.text:
Clinical case 21.
Symptoms: 35-year-old American man with fatigue and a painless papule progressing to a vesicle and black eschar with massive oedema.
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 35-year-old American man with fatigue and a painless papule progressing to a vesicle and black eschar with massive oedema.

Diagnosis: Cutaneous Anthrax

Confirmation/Key evidence: Gram stain/culture showing Gram-positive rods (Bacillus anthracis).

meta.symptoms: 35-year-old American man with fatigue and a painless papule progressing to a vesicle and black eschar with massive oedema.
meta.confirmation: Gram stain/culture showing Gram-positive rods (Bacillus anthracis).

content.text:
Clinical case 23.
Symptoms: 31-year-old HIV-positive man with dry cough, exertional dyspnoea, and desaturation.
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 31-year-old HIV-positive man with dry cough, exertional dyspnoea, and desaturation.

Diagnosis: Pneumocystis Pneumonia (PCP)

Confirmation/Key evidence: Chest X-ray (perihilar infiltrates); Grocott silver stain of BAL showing cysts.

meta.symptoms: 31-year-old HIV-positive man with dry cough, exertional dyspnoea, and desaturation.
meta.confirmation: Chest X-ray (perihilar infiltrates); Grocott silver stain of BAL showing cysts.

content.text:
Clinical case 24.
Symptoms: 14-year-old boy from rural Tanzania with sudden onset of non-progressive spastic paraparesis and ankle clonus.
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 14-year-old boy from rural Tanzania with sudden onset of non-progressive spastic paraparesis and ankle clonus.

Diagnosis: Konzo

Confirmation/Key evidence: Clinical diagnosis based on symptoms and exclusive cassava diet.

meta.symptoms: 14-year-old boy from rural Tanzania with sudden onset of non-progressive spastic paraparesis and ankle clonus.
meta.confirmation: Clinical diagnosis based on symptoms and exclusive cassava diet.

content.text:
Clinical case 25.
Symptoms: 72-year-old farmer from Laos with chronic, verrucous, cauliflower-like lesions on leg/foot.
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 72-year-old farmer from Laos with chronic, verrucous, cauliflower-like lesions on leg/foot.

Diagnosis: Chromoblastomycosis

Confirmation/Key evidence: Microscopy showing 'Medlar bodies' (sclerotic cells).

meta.symptoms: 72-year-old farmer from Laos with chronic, verrucous, cauliflower-like lesions on leg/foot.
meta.confirmation: Microscopy showing 'Medlar bodies' (sclerotic cells).

content.text:
Clinical case 26.
Symptoms: 14-year-old boy from Malawi bitten by a snake, presenting with extensive tissue necrosis, swelling, and shock.
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 14-year-old boy from Malawi bitten by a snake, presenting with extensive tissue necrosis, swelling, and shock.

Diagnosis: Snake Bite (African Puff-adder)

Confirmation/Key evidence: Clinical identification of Puff-adder (cytotoxic).

meta.symptoms: 14-year-old boy from Malawi bitten by a snake, presenting with extensive tissue necrosis, swelling, and shock.
meta.confirmation: Clinical identification of Puff-adder (cytotoxic).

content.text:
Clinical case 27.
Symptoms: 16-year-old boy from Sri Lanka with fever, muscle tenderness, subconjunctival haemorrhages, jaundice, renal failure.
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 16-year-old boy from Sri Lanka with fever, muscle tenderness, subconjunctival haemorrhages, jaundice, renal failure.

Diagnosis: Leptospirosis

Confirmation/Key evidence: Microscopic Agglutination Test (MAT).

meta.symptoms: 16-year-old boy from Sri Lanka with fever, muscle tenderness, subconjunctival haemorrhages, jaundice, renal failure.
meta.confirmation: Microscopic Agglutination Test (MAT).

content.text:
Clinical case 28.
Symptoms: 67-year-old female expatriate in Cameroon with transient subcutaneous swellings (Calabar swellings), eosinophilia.
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 67-year-old female expatriate in Cameroon with transient subcutaneous swellings (Calabar swellings), eosinophilia.

Diagnosis: Loiasis

Confirmation/Key evidence: Identification of sheathed Loa loa microfilariae in blood.

meta.symptoms: 67-year-old female expatriate in Cameroon with transient subcutaneous swellings (Calabar swellings), eosinophilia.
meta.confirmation: Identification of sheathed Loa loa microfilariae in blood.

content.text:
Clinical case 30.
Symptoms: 12-year-old boy from Kenya with eye pain, inturned eyelashes (trichiasis), and corneal scarring.
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 12-year-old boy from Kenya with eye pain, inturned eyelashes (trichiasis), and corneal scarring.

Diagnosis: Trachoma

Confirmation/Key evidence: Clinical diagnosis based on WHO criteria (Trichiasis, Corneal Opacity).

meta.symptoms: 12-year-old boy from Kenya with eye pain, inturned eyelashes (trichiasis), and corneal scarring.
meta.confirmation: Clinical diagnosis based on WHO criteria (Trichiasis, Corneal Opacity).

content.text:
Clinical case 31.
Symptoms: 6-year-old boy from Malawi with fever, cough, coryza, conjunctivitis, maculopapular rash.
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 6-year-old boy from Malawi with fever, cough, coryza, conjunctivitis, maculopapular rash.

Diagnosis: Measles

Confirmation/Key evidence: Clinical presentation and IgM serology.

meta.symptoms: 6-year-old boy from Malawi with fever, cough, coryza, conjunctivitis, maculopapular rash.
meta.confirmation: Clinical presentation and IgM serology.

content.text:
Clinical case 32.
Symptoms: 44-year-old diabetic male farmer from Laos with fever, back abscess, and pleural effusions.
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 44-year-old diabetic male farmer from Laos with fever, back abscess, and pleural effusions.

Diagnosis: Melioidosis (Disseminated)

Confirmation/Key evidence: Culture of pus/blood growing Burkholderia pseudomallei.

meta.symptoms: 44-year-old diabetic male farmer from Laos with fever, back abscess, and pleural effusions.
meta.confirmation: Culture of pus/blood growing Burkholderia pseudomallei.

content.text:
Clinical case 33.
Symptoms: 53-year-old man from Malawi with chronic cough, weight loss, hilar lymphadenopathy.
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 53-year-old man from Malawi with chronic cough, weight loss, hilar lymphadenopathy.

Diagnosis: Pulmonary Tuberculosis (Smear-negative)

Confirmation/Key evidence: Clinical/radiological diagnosis in HIV+ patient (smear negative).

meta.symptoms: 53-year-old man from Malawi with chronic cough, weight loss, hilar lymphadenopathy.
meta.confirmation: Clinical/radiological diagnosis in HIV+ patient (smear negative).

content.text:
Clinical case 34.
Symptoms: 35-year-old male farmer from Peru with a chronic ulcer on hand and nodular lymphangitis.
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 35-year-old male farmer from Peru with a chronic ulcer on hand and nodular lymphangitis.

Diagnosis: Sporotrichosis

Confirmation/Key evidence: Culture of Sporothrix schenckii from lesion aspirate.

meta.symptoms: 35-year-old male farmer from Peru with a chronic ulcer on hand and nodular lymphangitis.
meta.confirmation: Culture of Sporothrix schenckii from lesion aspirate.

content.text:
Clinical case 35.
Symptoms: Patient with chronic headache, blurred vision, and wasting (context of HIV).
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: Patient with chronic headache, blurred vision, and wasting (context of HIV).

Diagnosis: Cryptococcal Meningitis

Confirmation/Key evidence: CSF India Ink stain showing encapsulated yeast; CrAg test.

meta.symptoms: Patient with chronic headache, blurred vision, and wasting (context of HIV).
meta.confirmation: CSF India Ink stain showing encapsulated yeast; CrAg test.

content.text:
Clinical case 36.
Symptoms: 25-year-old monk from Myanmar with massive, non-tender scrotal swelling (hydrocele).
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 25-year-old monk from Myanmar with massive, non-tender scrotal swelling (hydrocele).

Diagnosis: Lymphatic Filariasis

Confirmation/Key evidence: Ultrasound (filarial dance sign), CFA antigen test.

meta.symptoms: 25-year-old monk from Myanmar with massive, non-tender scrotal swelling (hydrocele).
meta.confirmation: Ultrasound (filarial dance sign), CFA antigen test.

content.text:
Clinical case 37.
Symptoms: 29-year-old woman from Malawi with Dermatitis (photosensitive), Diarrhoea, Dementia.
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 29-year-old woman from Malawi with Dermatitis (photosensitive), Diarrhoea, Dementia.

Diagnosis: Pellagra

Confirmation/Key evidence: Clinical triad '3 Ds' and dietary history (maize).

meta.symptoms: 29-year-old woman from Malawi with Dermatitis (photosensitive), Diarrhoea, Dementia.
meta.confirmation: Clinical triad '3 Ds' and dietary history (maize).

content.text:
Clinical case 38.
Symptoms: 24-year-old female from Netherlands with focal seizures ('sensory march') and cystic brain lesions.
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 24-year-old female from Netherlands with focal seizures ('sensory march') and cystic brain lesions.

Diagnosis: Neurocysticercosis

Confirmation/Key evidence: MRI showing cysts; EITB serology.

meta.symptoms: 24-year-old female from Netherlands with focal seizures ('sensory march') and cystic brain lesions.
meta.confirmation: MRI showing cysts; EITB serology.

content.text:
Clinical case 39.
Symptoms: 30-year-old male trader from China/Laos with persistent fever and parasitaemia despite treatment.
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 30-year-old male trader from China/Laos with persistent fever and parasitaemia despite treatment.

Diagnosis: Malaria (Treatment Failure)

Confirmation/Key evidence: Chemical analysis revealing falsified drug packaging.

meta.symptoms: 30-year-old male trader from China/Laos with persistent fever and parasitaemia despite treatment.
meta.confirmation: Chemical analysis revealing falsified drug packaging.

content.text:
Clinical case 41.
Symptoms: 7-year-old girl from West Africa with painless necrotic skin ulcers with undermined edges.
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 7-year-old girl from West Africa with painless necrotic skin ulcers with undermined edges.

Diagnosis: Buruli Ulcer

Confirmation/Key evidence: PCR for IS2404 of Mycobacterium ulcerans.

meta.symptoms: 7-year-old girl from West Africa with painless necrotic skin ulcers with undermined edges.
meta.confirmation: PCR for IS2404 of Mycobacterium ulcerans.

content.text:
Clinical case 42.
Symptoms: 41-year-old male traveller returning from Australia with intensely itchy, serpiginous track-like eruptions.
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 41-year-old male traveller returning from Australia with intensely itchy, serpiginous track-like eruptions.

Diagnosis: Cutaneous Larva Migrans

Confirmation/Key evidence: Clinical appearance of creeping eruption.

meta.symptoms: 41-year-old male traveller returning from Australia with intensely itchy, serpiginous track-like eruptions.
meta.confirmation: Clinical appearance of creeping eruption.

content.text:
Clinical case 43.
Symptoms: HIV-reactive patient with painful, growing, fungating tumour destroying the eye (implied).
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: HIV-reactive patient with painful, growing, fungating tumour destroying the eye (implied).

Diagnosis: Ocular Surface Squamous Neoplasia (OSSN)

Confirmation/Key evidence: Clinical appearance; histology confirming squamous cell carcinoma.

meta.symptoms: HIV-reactive patient with painful, growing, fungating tumour destroying the eye (implied).
meta.confirmation: Clinical appearance; histology confirming squamous cell carcinoma.

content.text:
Clinical case 44.
Symptoms: 7-year-old girl from South Sudan with undulating fever, wasting, massive splenomegaly, pancytopenia.
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 7-year-old girl from South Sudan with undulating fever, wasting, massive splenomegaly, pancytopenia.

Diagnosis: Visceral Leishmaniasis (Kala-Azar)

Confirmation/Key evidence: DAT positive; rK39 dipstick positive.

meta.symptoms: 7-year-old girl from South Sudan with undulating fever, wasting, massive splenomegaly, pancytopenia.
meta.confirmation: DAT positive; rK39 dipstick positive.

content.text:
Clinical case 47.
Symptoms: 32-year-old man from Malawi with worsening cervical lymphadenitis after starting ART.
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 32-year-old man from Malawi with worsening cervical lymphadenitis after starting ART.

Diagnosis: Immune Reconstitution Inflammatory Syndrome (IRIS) - TB

Confirmation/Key evidence: Paradoxical worsening despite effective therapy, coincident with immune recovery.

meta.symptoms: 32-year-old man from Malawi with worsening cervical lymphadenitis after starting ART.
meta.confirmation: Paradoxical worsening despite effective therapy, coincident with immune recovery.

content.text:
Clinical case 48.
Symptoms: 31-year-old woman from Tanzania with acute onset flaccid paraplegia, sensory level, bladder retention.
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 31-year-old woman from Tanzania with acute onset flaccid paraplegia, sensory level, bladder retention.

Diagnosis: Acute Transverse Myelitis

Confirmation/Key evidence: Clinical features of spinal cord inflammation.

meta.symptoms: 31-year-old woman from Tanzania with acute onset flaccid paraplegia, sensory level, bladder retention.
meta.confirmation: Clinical features of spinal cord inflammation.

content.text:
Clinical case 49.
Symptoms: 33-year-old male traveller to India with persistent watery diarrhoea, bloating, foul-smelling flatulence.
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 33-year-old male traveller to India with persistent watery diarrhoea, bloating, foul-smelling flatulence.

Diagnosis: Giardiasis

Confirmation/Key evidence: Stool microscopy identifying Giardia cysts/trophozoites.

meta.symptoms: 33-year-old male traveller to India with persistent watery diarrhoea, bloating, foul-smelling flatulence.
meta.confirmation: Stool microscopy identifying Giardia cysts/trophozoites.

content.text:
Clinical case 50.
Symptoms: 24-year-old man of Turkish origin with jaundice and right upper quadrant pain (liver cysts).
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 24-year-old man of Turkish origin with jaundice and right upper quadrant pain (liver cysts).

Diagnosis: Cystic Echinococcosis (Hydatid Disease)

Confirmation/Key evidence: Ultrasound/CT showing cysts with daughter cysts.

meta.symptoms: 24-year-old man of Turkish origin with jaundice and right upper quadrant pain (liver cysts).
meta.confirmation: Ultrasound/CT showing cysts with daughter cysts.

content.text:
Clinical case 51.
Symptoms: 34-year-old HIV-reactive woman from Malawi with progressive left-sided weakness (hemiparesis) and visual deficits.
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 34-year-old HIV-reactive woman from Malawi with progressive left-sided weakness (hemiparesis) and visual deficits.

Diagnosis: Progressive Multifocal Leukoencephalopathy (PML)

Confirmation/Key evidence: MRI showing non-enhancing white matter lesions.
